name: lvecdrng

stmt.origin: simprbi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, cdr), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: simprbi(c0 ∈ LVec, c1 ∈ DivRing, c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, cdr))
-| wb(wcel(c0, clvec), wa(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cdr)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, cdr))
-| wb(wcel(c0, clvec), wa(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cdr)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, clvec), wa(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cdr)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing))
⊣ c1 =(Scalar ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c1, cdr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

comment: The set of scalars of a left vector space is a division ring. (Contributed by NM, 17-Apr-2014.)
